alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:49PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Osage and central Lyon Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 949 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Emporia, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Neosho Rapids, Reading and Melvern Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 143. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 121 and 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Kansas.
